page.title: 11Entertainment in Barnburgh.
page.content: The biggest village fund-raising event is the Summer Carnival, which has been held every year since it was started in 1971 to raise funds for the building of the hall. In Barnburgh and Harlington we have three pubs and a club. The pubs are called "The Harlington Inn","The Crown Inn"and "The Coach and Horses" which was opened in 1937.A fishing permit for Barnburgh Pond can be obtained at the club. The pond has very good coarse fishing facilities, and is situated close to the old village,but is nestled amongst trees and surrounded by gently sloping fields.The fish to be caught is perch, tench,roach and carp.Maggots for fishing can be obtained from a local Maggot Farm, situated just outside the village.
